question: Which are the two countries that share the location of the "Janga Mountain"?
explanation: Russia and Georgia are the two countries that share the location of the "Janga Mountain". Janga or Jangi-Tau is a summit in the central part of the Greater Caucasus Mountain Range. It lies on the border of Svaneti (Georgia) and Kabardino-Balkaria (Russia). The elevation of the mountain is 5,051 m above sea level. The slopes of the mountain are heavily glaciated. They are most famous for the dormant volcanoes that are hidden under the ice caps.
